titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Brandenberg receipts 1977.473
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-11-29 21:35:24 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: This collection contains carriage maker William Brandenberg's receipts for water bills and other city taxes dated circa 1875-1887.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: William Brandenberg, a carriage maker, resided at 384 Hamilton Avenue in Brooklyn. His shop was located at 385 Hamilton Avenue.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); William Brandenberg receipts, 1977.473, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level. This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains William Brandenberg's receipts for water bills and other city taxes dated circa 1875-1887.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The material in this collection is in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
